name: Royal Berkshire Hotel

reviews.text: Old world charm.
reviews.title: What about the room service?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night whilst on a business trip. This place has character and charm, and is well located in Ascot. It is tucked away, away from any road noise and surrounded by gardens. My room had a view of the grounds and was in quiet spot.. The room was dated and small, but was kitted with everything a business traveller needs. The only complaint I have is the inconsistent wi fi and the lack of room service. Small details, but very important for a business traveller, and something the hotel can easily resolve.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and location

reviews.text: THE PROS: Great Value hotel, beautiful historic building in a quiet location, F&B in the hotel was top class, service from restaurant and reception staff was exemplary.
reviews.title: Good choice if you can get a decent rate.

reviews.text: THE CONS: Small room, no room service, wi-fi access in my room was rubbish, no air-con.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel Shame About Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: TIP - ensure you book for breakfast, and for a casual dinner ensure you dine in the bar.. Great hotel for a short stay.
reviews.title: Lovely Romantic Stay

reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 nights while attending meetings held in the hotel. The public rooms and meeting areas are nicely decorated and the service was excellent. My sleeping room was a disappointment though. I am American and used to our modern hotels, of course, and knew that this hotel was a converted country home over a 100 years old, so did not expect it to be like a new Westin! However for the price, I expected it to be more updated or furnished in a finer style. My room was on the third floor (no elevator) and the staircase up to the floor was narrow, ancient and slanted --- very difficult to navigate with luggage.
reviews.title: Good meeting rooms, sleeping rooms can use updating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was a decent size and was very clean. The furniture was dorm room-like and old and nicked up. The bed was squishy and was outfitted with a non-fitted bottom sheet that kept coming untucked and a comforter. That's it, no top sheet (maybe this is an English thing, but I don't remember lacking a top sheet in other European hotels). The room was warm, but I was too cool with nothing and too warm with the comforter. Ugh, had to sleep with the window open, but it was only allowed to go up about 3 inches. The plumbing in the entire hotel was such that I had to flush 2 or 3 times to get "everything" to disappear. Again, this may be one of the things one needs to expect in a charming older property. The free wireless internet was nice that it was free but it was terribly slow. TV channel offerings were limited.
reviews.title: Very thin walls and poor quality bed linen but great staff

reviews.text: I ate dinner the first night in the dining room and the food was fine, though pricey (so was the wine). I wished they offered small salads as an appetizer on the menu. Was very impressed by the waitstaff in both the dining room and the bar. Very friendly and efficient. The breakfast offerings were good and plenty to please all. The food and drinks offered for meeting attendees in their break area was enjoyable -- LOVED the fresh squeezed OJ and the cookies! Both days for lunch, we were offered thin sandwiches, tiny salads (both days with fish on them, which many in our group did not care for, anchovies on the Caesar and tuna fish on a mixed green salad) along with meat kabobs and mini sausages. We all were longing for more salad and veggie offerings across lunch and dinner. I also wished they would replenish the water and glasses in the meeting room and would've left the fruit and desserts for us to enjoy for the afternoon, but they would whisk them away at the end of lunch. Several in our group were grumbling about the lack of availability of Diet Coke....a staple in the American female diet and important source of caffeine!! Available only at the bar for a tiny bottle for 2.75 pounds...yikes!
reviews.title: A good place for a one night stopover

reviews.text: All in all, The Royal Berkshire is a lovely old building with a great staff on beautiful grounds. If they invest in updating the rooms with new carpeting, furniture etc and upgrade the bedding, this could be a real gem.
reviews.title: Not Impressed

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for one night at The Royal Berkshire hotel in an Executive Deluxe Double room in the modern part of the building.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay
Lovely venue
reviews.text: We stayed for one night after attending a wedding locally. On arrival the staff where very helpful and managed to find us a room early, which was in the new wing on the third floor. We had to walk the length of the hotel to get to the room and it was noticeable that many of the corridors and meeting rooms had recently been refurbished and that new carpets where installed.the room was well furnished, but didn't have the wow factor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The dining rooms, bar and public areas are beautiful rooms and the gardens are wonderful. On arrival after the wedding at 11pm the bar was empty, but staff where still available, very friendly and extremly helpful. Breakfast in the morning was served from a buffet, which had a good range of hot and cold options. Service was a lot disorganised though very friendly.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel in prime location

reviews.text: A couple of things could be improved. It seems odd that when the new wing was built that nobody thought to include a lift? It wasn't a problem for us, but older visitors or those having babies might find getting to the higher floors a bit of a struggle. Also the guest rooms are very hot, which is ideal for winter, but probably far too hot in summer. Air conditioning really needs to be fitted in the guest rooms.
reviews.title: Nice location, dated rooms and no room service

reviews.text: We had booked a room for just one night at the Royal Berkshire and weren’t disappointed. The hotel was well signposted and easy to find. As you drive in towards the hotel you are greeted with a pleasant view of the gardens and scenery - think of your typical flattering countryside hotel and you’ve got the Royal Berkshire. We were impressed with the outside appearance of the hotel and equally so with the elegant reception and hall area. The girl that took our booking details at reception was friendly and helpful; she covered everything from breakfast times, use of the leisure facilities etc. and most importantly, how to find our room.
reviews.title: Beautiful old hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was spacious, clean and comfortably. Aesthetically, the room didn’t possess a ‘wow’ factor, but corresponded well with the age of the building. I suspect a refurbishment may be due in the near future. The room contained the usual... LCD TV, coffee/tea making devices, hair dryer, bath towels, lotions, shower gels etc. I did notice however that there was no air-conditioning in the room but a large fan was provided which kept us cool at night. Another small gripe would be that the shower was very weak – there’s nothing more frustrating than a half-hearted shower in the morning. The hotel features a small gym and indoor pool. We didn’t use the gym but the pool was fab, there was no one else using it and we felt like we could totally relax. A covering of paint in the changing and pool area and smaller things like new locker key straps - to replace all of the broken ones would be a good idea for improvement.
reviews.title: Perfect place for a wedding, Anniversary or just to stay and eat...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed a couple of nights with my partner. Large, comfortable room overlooking the gardens. Good choice for breakfast. The evening meal was excellent. All of the staff were great, friendly and helpful. It is not cheap but I would certainly recommended this hotel.
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a night and our room was comfy. We had a bathroom with quite a small bath but lots of hot water. Shower not very powerful. Staff friendly but a map is needed to find your room, god knows what would happen in an emergency! Few hairs in bathroom that didnt belong to us :S Clean towels and comfy bed, but again a little small nearly fell out a good few times in the night! Ate breakfast but would reccomend going elsewhere, we got there at 9 but not much on offer as a whole and a bit of a pain to keep getting up to walk to the seperate room. They seemed V over staffed at breakfast and perhaps they could use the staff to more use? Over all value for money and set in very pretty grounds.
reviews.title: Comfy
Weird customer service
reviews.text: It's a lovely location and ideal for Ascot races - 10 mins in a taxi - but there's something weird about the customer service here. My wife and I stayed two nights over the Champions race day weekend , Frankel's swan song. The hotel was understandably busy, but the staff were not behaving normally. We were told there was no table available for dinner when we came down for a drink, post swim and sauna, yet they made no mention of the fact we needed to book a table when we checked in. Then, on departure we were made to feel it was our mistake that they'd ordered us papers on the Sunday, when we had not asked for these. Other than that, great food and nice atmosphere. The rooms were comfortable if a little tired looking. Not sure I'd recommend this hotel whileheartedly, but I suppose we could have just caught them on a bad day.

We stayed only a night here prior to a visit to Legoland. Service was unfailingly friendly and helpful. We had a quiet room on the ground floor, close to the pool and overlooking the gardens and area outside the bar. Pool small but nice. Room was clean and bed comfortable - although non-Brits may like to note that British beds are doubles so not huge! We had pre-warned staff about our dietary needs and were delighted when the chef came out and discussed what they could do for us. We had risotto and pasta, garlic bread and salads - an enormous amount of food. For breakfast we had vegan sausages as part of our cooked breakfast, and soya milk/spread were provided. Miss 8 cheekily requested strawberries - and got them! A lovely hotel in beautiful grounds with excellent staff - would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: Couldn't fault it - happily catered for vegans!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here in July for a one night romantic stay and to be honest it wasn't anything special. The hotel and grounds were beautiful but upon arrival the receptionists were quite rude and not very welcoming. The room was pretty basic but as it was a last minute we wasn't that bothered as we were out most of the time. Was pleasantly surprised when we woke up and a man was staring into our window and cleaning the windows for about 15 minutes just staring, we didn't get told about it and found it quite strange and rude. We complained and the receptionist wasn't that bothered. Breakfast seating was in one room and breakfast was 150yards down the corridor which I found a bit strange. Another thing, cab companies are very expensive and if you don't drive then you are in the middle of nowhere and buses come every 1 1/2 hour or so. Good for an over night stay.
reviews.title: Mediocre

description: Built for the Churchill family, the fountain and sweeping 15-acre landscaped grounds flank a spectacular red brick Queen Anne mansion. Peaceful sophistication is the order of the day... dine in FORK Restaurant overlooking the manicured gardens or play croquet on the lawn whilst sipping a glass of Pimms! Just 1.5 miles from Ascot train station, 13 miles from London Heathrow Airport and within 8 miles of the M25, M4 and M3, the Royal Berkshire Hotel is perfectly situated for short breaks away, corporate events and meetings and fabulous weddings!
